featured.text: There her keepers have gradually introduced her to the ways of the wild, helping her to find food and water.
At the sanctuary, keepers now use recorded howler sounds from a distance so that the monkeys feel the need to make the territorial calls as they would do in the wild.
Why do the keepers at the sanctuary use recorded howls? (A) To prevent the howler monkeys from getting homesick.

F. Frank Well, if zoos are an inevitability, zoo keepers must provide the best possible conditions for the animals that live in captivity—to say the least! G. George Zoos have an educational aspect to it.

definition.en_def: A person who is responsible for the care or management of something.
definition.example: The zoo keeper fed the animals every morning.
